title: Calories in Steel Cut Oats
meta_description: Discover calories in steel cut oats per 100 g dry, including carbs, protein, fiber, and full nutrition breakdown with tweaks and FAQs.
assumptions: Dry, uncooked steel cut oats; plain, no added sugar, salt, or flavorings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, processing, and preparation method (dry vs. cooked). Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of dry steel cut oats provides ~379 kcal, 13 g protein, and 10.6 g fiber.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tbsp brown sugar per 100 g
Cook with 1 tsp butter per 100 g dry
Add 1/4 cup milk (instead of water) per 100 g dry

faqs.q: How many calories in 100 g steel cut oats?
faqs.a: About 379 kcal for 100 g dry steel cut oats.

faqs.q: Are steel cut oats high in fiber?
faqs.a: Yes, ~10.6 g dietary fiber per 100 g dry, aiding digestion.

faqs.q: Calories in cooked steel cut oats?
faqs.a: Per 100 g cooked (from ~28 g dry), ~71 kcal; water dilutes calories.

faqs.q: How much protein in steel cut oats?
faqs.a: Approximately 12.5 g protein per 100 g dry.

faqs.q: Difference between steel cut and rolled oats calories?
faqs.a: Similar; both ~380 kcal per 100 g dry, but steel cut takes longer to cook.
